intro: Lindsaea liankwangensis, commonly known as the Liangkang lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan province, where it thrives in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant features a creeping rhizome with dense, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a cluster of small, greenish-white flowers that are borne on short pedicels. Lindsaea liankwangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
